AI Description: GMAP and GSnap are splice-aware algorithms for mapping RNA-Seq reads to a genome. GMAP is a genomic mapping and alignment program while GSnap is a sensitive and accurate gapped read mapper. Both tools are commonly used in bioinformatics for RNA-Seq analysis.
Core Features: Splice-Aware RNA-Seq Read Mapping, Alignment To A Reference Genome, Identification Of Novel Splice Sites, Support For Gapped Alignment
